title-part.text: Use of inorganic or non-macromolecular organic substances as compounding ingredients

reference.text: paints, inks, varnishes, dyes, polishes, adhesives C09

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, an ingredient is classified in the last appropriate place.

In this subclass: a mixture of ingredients is classified in the most indented group covering all the essential ingredients of the mixture, e.g.:
a mixture of a monohydric and a polyhydric alcohol C08K5/05
a mixture of two polyhydric alcohols C08K5/053
a mixture of an alcohol and an ether C08K5/04
a mixture of an ether and an amine C08K5/00
a mixture of an amine and a metal C08K13/02
This note is applied only for mixtures with more than three essential ingredients. Mixtures with two or three ingredients are classified in the appropriate groups of C08K, e.g. a mixture of Al2O3, an ether and an amine is classified in C08K3/22, C08K5/06 and C08K5/17
ammonium salts are classified in the same way as metal salts

In this subclass, any ingredient of a mixture which is not identified by the classification according to Note (2) above, and the use of which is determined to be novel and non-obvious, must also be classified in this subclass according to Note (1). The ingredient can be either a single compound or a composition in itself. ".This IPC Note does not apply in CPC

Any ingredient of a mixture which is not identified by the classification according to Notes (2) or (3) above, and which is considered to represent information of interest for search, may also be classified in this subclass according to Note (1). This can, for example, be the case when it is considered of interest to enable searching of mixtures using a combination of classification symbols. Such non-obligatory classification should be given as "additional information".This IPC Note does not apply in CPC

note-paragraph.CPC-specific-note: In this subclass, combination sets [C-Sets] are used. The detailed information about the C-Sets construction and the associated syntax rules is present in the definitions of C08K
In this subclass, organic acid salts, alcoholates, phenolates or mercaptides are classified in the groups or subgroups of the parent compounds

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Use of inorganic substances as compounding ingredients

note.note-paragraph: In this group, C-Sets are used. The detailed information about the C-Sets construction and the associated syntax rules is present in the Definitions of C08K.

title-part.text: Crosslinking or vulcanising agents, e.g. accelerators
Additives activating the degradation of the macromolecular compounds
Stabilisers against oxidation, heat, light or ozone

reference.text: macromolecular substances as carriers for biocide material A01N25/10

CPC-specific-text.text: Graphene or derivatives, e.g. graphene oxides
Carbon nanorods, nanowires, nanoplatelets or nanofibres

title-part.text: Compounds containing metals of Groups 1 to 3 or Groups 11 to 13 of the Periodic system
Compounds containing metals of Groups 4 to 10 or Groups 14 to 16 of the Periodic system

CPC-specific-text.text: Calcium, strontium or barium halides, e.g. calcium, strontium or barium chloride
Binary compounds of nitrogen with aluminium
of magnesium, calcium, strontium or barium
Binary compounds of nitrogen with boron

note.note-paragraph: In this group, C-Sets are used. The detailed information about the C-Sets construction and the associated syntax rules is present in the Definitions of C08K.

CPC-specific-text.text: Organic ingredients according to more than one of the "one dot" groups of C08K5/01 - C08K5/59
Crosslinking or vulcanising agents; including accelerators
Additives activating the degradation of the macromolecular compound
Stabilisers against oxidation, heat, light, ozone

reference.text: macromolecular substances as carriers for biocide material A01N25/10

CPC-specific-text.text: Nucleating agents promoting the crystallisation of the polymer matrix

title-part.text: Heterocyclic compounds having oxygen in the ring
having one oxygen atom in the ring
having two oxygen atoms in the ring
having more than two oxygen atoms in the ring

CPC-specific-text.text: containing COOH-groups; Esters or salts thereof

title-part.text: Compounds containing nitrogen bound to another nitrogen atom
Compounds containing a nitrogen atom bound to two other nitrogen atoms, e.g. diazoamino-compounds
Compounds containing nitrogen bound to oxygen
Heterocyclic compounds having nitrogen in the ring
having one nitrogen atom in the ring
having two nitrogen atoms in the ring
having more than two nitrogen atoms in the ring

CPC-specific-text.text: also containing heterocyclic groups other than triazine groups

title-part.text: having also oxygen in the ring

CPC-specific-text.text: ; i.e. compounds containing -X-C(=X)- groups, X being oxygen or sulfur, at least one X being sulfur

title-part.text: Compounds containing sulfur bound to oxygen
Compounds containing sulfur bound to nitrogen
Heterocyclic compounds having sulfur in the ring
with oxygen or nitrogen in the ring
Esters of phosphoric acids, e.g. of H3PO4
Esters of phosphorous acids, e.g. of H3PO3
Esters containing heterocyclic rings not representing cyclic esters of phosphoric or phosphorous acids
bound to oxygen and to carbon only
containing heterocyclic rings not representing cyclic esters of phosphonic acids

CPC-specific-text.text: containing no other elements than carbon or hydrogen
containing elements other than oxygen or nitrogen

title-part.text: containing at least one Si—O bond
containing at least one Si—C bond
containing at least one C=C bond

note.note-paragraph:
Group C08K5/544 is impacted by reclassification into group C08K5/5445.
Groups C08K5/544 and C08K5/5445 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: containing at least one Si-N bond

note.note-paragraph:
Group C08K5/5445 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group C08K5/544.
Groups C08K5/544 and C08K5/5445 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: containing at least one C=N bond
containing at least one C≡N bond

In this group, C-Sets are used. The detailed information about the C-Sets construction and the associated syntax rules is present in the Definitions of C08K.

Use of ingredients of unknown constitution, e.g. undefined reaction products

title-part.text: Use of mixtures of ingredients not covered by one single of the preceding main groups, each of these compounds being essential

note.note-paragraph: In this group, C-Sets are used. The detailed information about the C-Sets construction and the associated syntax rules is present in the Definitions of C08K.

title-part.text: Ingredients characterised by their shape and organic or inorganic ingredients
Pretreated ingredients and ingredients covered by the main groups C08K3/00 - C08K7/00
Ingredients of unknown constitution and ingredients covered by the main groups C08K3/00 - C08K9/00
Additives being defined by their diameter
Additives being defined by their length
Additives being defined by their particle size in general
Additives being defined by their surface area
Additives being defined by their hardness
Additives applied to the surface of polymers or polymer particles
Additives containing two or more different additives of the same subgroup in C08K

the composition being defined by the absence of a certain additive
